result.execSummary:
The defendant Joevena L Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Good time credit and release to the Day Reporting Center and child care release.

Should defendant complete all conditions set forth by the Court and Probation Department, pay all court costs and surcharges as ordered, and remain free and clear of the criminal justice system arising to the level of probable cause, the Court will consider petition for expungement.

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, plus all costs, surcharges and disbursements. Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against the defendant.

Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Obtain GED.
No contact with Lt. William Kowalski.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Undergo a mental health evaluation; follow through with any treatment needed.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for her mental or physical needs; take all medications as described.
Anger management counseling/class.
Parenting classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court further advised the defendant of voting ineligibility.

AODA assessment; treatment if needed.
No alcohol.
Urine screens.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.

records.addlTxt: /from Justice Point, filed.
Sentencing Memorandum "dated June 30, 2014", received and filed.
/and Restitution Worksheet, filed.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial and defense counsel unable to come back in the afternoon (will be in another court on a motion hearing).    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Justice Point report received and filed; defendant compliant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Justice Point, filed.
Sentencing Memorandum, submitted on behalf of defendant, filed.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request another date for sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received and provided to both parties.  Neither party challenges findings in report; defendant also believes she is competent to proceed.  Court finds defendant competent and ordered proceedings reinstated. 

Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/received and filed.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 08-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on July 31, 2014 at 10:00 a.m.  Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Court ordered proceedings SUSPENDED and case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 20.

Court advised defendant not to appear in court with any children.

Parties request a brief adjournment; State is awaiting information from victim.  Court warned that this will be the LAST adjournment.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court granted defense request and ordered case continued before Branch 20 and that all conditions of bail continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel needs addtional time to speak to the State. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/24/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Joevena L Porter in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Joevena L Porter in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
